result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cases 21CF68, 22CF23, & 22CF154 called @ 4:12 PM: Defendant Joseph A. Marvin in court, in custody. Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Joseph A. Marvin. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court. Bond modification argument by Atty Zamzow. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Statement by the Court. The Court will authorize the release of $2500 posted in case 21CF68 be returned to the poster. The Court denies the release of $3500 cash bond posted in case 22CF23.
Bail/bond hearing on October 18, 2022 at 04:05 pm.
Letter to Court from Attorney Zamzow regarding return of bonds posted

Cases 22CF154, 21CF68, & 22CF23 called @ 2:16 PM Defendant Joseph A. Marvin in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Joseph A. Marvin.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF154: Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. DE stands mute on plea. The Court enters NG plea as to all counts on behalf of the DE. As to all cases: STC scheduled - NOH given.

22CF23 & 21CF68 10:49 AM cases called. Defendant Joseph A. Marvin appeared in court, Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared in court for Joseph A. Marvin, Attorney Matthew R. Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  22CF23-Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over. information filed. Attorney Zamzow confirms receipt, waives formal reading and defendant stands mute. Court entes NGP on behalf of defendant.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:21 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on February 8, 2022 at 10:55 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.
Defendant and Atty Heywood appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 12:49 PM Defendant Joseph A. Marvin in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Eric R Heywood.  Dennis J Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Bond argument by Atty Heywood. Court orders $3500 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 10:55 am.
